body_html: I also encountered the same problem. There really was an issue with one of the TFRecord files I had. The way that I found it was to loop over all TFRecords and create a TFRecordDataset. Then I parsed them and just tried to access the data. I just printed the name of TFRecord files and then found the ones which were problematic. For me, it was because I was using a very large dataset and my hard drive limit on the cluster was met and my code created some corrupted TFRecords.

body: I also encountered the same problem. There really was an issue with one of the TFRecord files I had. The way that I found it was to loop over all TFRecords and create a TFRecordDataset. Then I parsed them and just tried to access the data. I just printed the name of TFRecord files and then found the ones which were problematic. For me, it was because I was using a very large dataset and my hard drive limit on the cluster was met and my code created some corrupted TFRecords.
